properties.otherAdvice:
Pregnancy Babies & Childrens Expo at Sydney Showground on Saturday 18 and Sunday 19 May. Expo runs from 10am to 4pm daily.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the precinct as attendees travel to and from the event. Ticketholders to Saturday’s event can expect heavy traffic leaving the precinct late afternoon as an AFL match also takes place at neighbouring ENGIE Stadium. 

Allow extra travel time on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees who need to drive should pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space - available until 11:59pm the night before the events unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. View the interactive map for closure details.﻿

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Additional route 199 buses will also run towards Manly and Mona Vale after the game to help you get home. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sea Eagles v Storm at 4 Pines Park in Brookvale. Preliminary game kick-off at 6pm, NRL kick-off at 8pm, full time around 10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pittwater Rd, Old Pittwater Rd, Warringah Rd and Beacon Hill Rd as fans travel to the stadium during the already busy Friday evening peak.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and plan to arrive early as parking will be in high demand, and also be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Light rail services run regularly. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Race Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race at 11am, last race at 4:35pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to the races.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads, and high volumes of taxi and rideshare pick ups and drop offs.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on trains, and event shuttle buses will run from Caringbah, Cronulla and Woolooware train stations before and after the game. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sharks v Panthers at PointsBet Stadium in Woolooware. Kick-off from 5:30pm, full-time approx 7:50pm.

Road closures will be in place on Captain Cook Drive from approximately 10 minutes before kick-off and remain in place until crowds have cleared after full-time.

Traffic on roads approaching the stadium will be heavier than usual as fans travel to and from the match. Allow extra travel time on Captain Cook Dr, Woolooware Rd and Gannons Rd. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Bulldogs v Dragons at Accor Stadium. NSW Cup kick-off from 5.25pm. NRL kick-off at 7.50pm, full time around 9.35pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as fans travel to the match during the busy weeknight evening peak. Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Consider parking at a nearby train station commuter carpark and continuing your trip on one of the many extra trains running to Olympic Park, at no extra cost.

If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. View the interactive map for closure details.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
Music concerts at Sydney Showground from 4pm Saturday and 2pm Sunday.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as music fans travel to the events over the weekend. Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. View the interactive map for closure details.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on public transport. Express trains and Major Event Buses will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
International Women's Football: Matildas v China PR at Accor Stadium. Kick-off at 7:40pm, full-time at 9:35pm.

With 77,000 fans expected traffic delays are expected during the busy weeknight evening peak.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

  • Car parks: Pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space. Parking is selling fast.
  • Do not drive unless you have pre-booked parking as there may not be parking available on site. You will need to catch public transport.
  • Consider parking at a nearby train station commuter carpark and continuing your trip on one of the many extra trains running to Olympic Park, at no extra cost.
  • If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events and accommodate additional transport services. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

arrangementElements.html:
Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct and traffic congestion is expected before and after the match. For road closure details, visit the Sydney Olympic Park Authority interactive map.

  • Dawn Fraser Avenue from Showground Rd to Edwin Flack Ave
  • Olympic Boulevard from Herb Elliot Ave to Kevin Coombs Ave

  • Olympic Boulevard between Sarah Durack and Herb Elliott Avenue
  • Shirly Strickland between P4 Roundabout and Rod Laver.
  • Rod Laver Avenue at the rear of Tennis Centre.

From 2pm Monday 3 June to 3am Tuesday 4 June

  • Showground Rd from Grand Parade to the Novotel Loading Dock.
  • Murray Rose Ave from Showground Road to Gate 15 and restricted access from Park Street.
  • Grand Pde from Orana Ave to Olympic Blvd
  • Dawn Fraser Ave from Park Street to Showground Road.

From 9pm Monday 3 June to 3am Tuesday 4 June

  • Edwin Flack Ave from Pondage Link to Old Hill Link (westbound)
  • Edwin Flack Avenue North bound from Bernie Avenue to Old Hill Link
  • Murray Rose Avenue from Park Street to Australia Avenue
  • Dawn Fraser Avenue from Park Street to Australia Avenue
  • Herb Elliott Avenue closed at Park Street.

properties.otherAdvice:
State of Origin Game I at Accor Stadium. Preliminary game kick-off at 6pm, pre-show entertainment at 7:30pm and State of Origin Game I kick-off at 8:05pm. Full-time approx 10:05pm.

With around 80,000 fans expected traffic delays are expected during the busy weeknight evening peak.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

  • Car parks: Pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space. Parking is selling fast.
  • Do not drive unless you have pre-booked parking as there may not be parking available on site. You will need to catch public transport.
  • Consider parking at a nearby train station commuter carpark and continuing your trip on one of the many extra trains running to Olympic Park, at no extra cost.
  • If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events and accommodate additional transport services. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct and traffic congestion is expected before and after the match. For road closure details, visit the Sydney Olympic Park Authority interactive map.

arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Greek Festival will be taking place on Bay St on Sunday 26 May. Road closures and parking restrictions will be in effect.

From 2am Sunday 26 May until 3am Monday 27 May the following roads will be closed:

  • Bay St between Queens Rd and The Grand Pde
  • Bay St between Crawford St and Queens Rd (Eastbound lanes)
  • Moate Ave between Bay St and Saywell Ln

Motorists travelling on The Grand Parade can detour around the road closures via local roads.

Motorist are advised to allow extra travel time, be aware of increased pedestrian activity and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site.

From 2am Sunday 26 May until 3am Monday 27 May special event clearways will also be in effect on sections of Moate St and Bay St. Motorists are advised to check signs before parking as vehicles in special event clearways will be towed and fines apply.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

From 2am Sunday 26 May to 3am Monday 27 May 2024

  • Bay Street between Queens Road and The Grand Parade
  • Bay Street between Crawford Street and Queens Road (Eastbound)
  • Moate Avenue between Bay Street and Saywell Lane

SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

From 2am Sunday 26 May to 3am Monday 27 May 2024

  • Bay Street between Queens Street and The Grand Parade (Both sides)
  • Moate Avenue between Bay Street and Saywell Lane (Both sides)
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures & Special Event Clearways

properties.publicTransport: For safety reasons, attendees can only enter the event by catching a free shuttle bus. The Central Coast Air Show will operate five shuttle bus routes starting from 8am each day and on constant rotation from multiple locations. Trains from Newcastle and Sydney run regularly to the Central Coast. Shuttle buses will run between Warnervale, Tuggerah and Wyong train stations and the event.
properties.otherAdvice: The Central Coast Air Show will be held from 9am to 5pm on 25-26 May at Warnervale Airport. IMPORTANT: there will be no parking on site, or on Sparks Road, and no pedestrian access to the event. Motorists are advised to exercise caution in the area with a reduced speed limit along Sparks Road.

properties.publicTransport: On Fridays from 6pm and weekends from 5pm buses and light rail services will not run to Circular Quay. Buses will be relocated to stops at Martin Place and light rail services will run to and from Town Hall only. On Saturday nights and Sunday of the long weekend from 6pm to 11pm trains will not drop off passengers at Circular Quay. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your Vivid Sydney experience.
properties.otherAdvice:
Vivid Sydney returns for its 14th year to light up the city for 23 consecutive nights from Friday 24 May to Saturday 15 June from 6pm to 11pm each night. Motorists are encouraged to avoid travelling around Circular Quay and The Rocks during Vivid or to expect delays on local roads, particularly on weekends.

KEY ROAD CLOSURES

Roads in Circular Quay, The Rocks and Millers Point will be closed each night from 5pm with additional closures on Friday nights and weekends in the city and around Darling Harbour. Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect each night. Some local roads will be closed nightly including Cumberland St south of Essex St from 12pm - midnight, Circular Quay West at the Overseas Passenger Terminal from 3pm - midnight, Thomas St from Quay St from 5.30pm - midnight.

Monday to Thursdays

  • 5pm – midnight: George St north of Alfred St, Hickson Rd to Pottinger St, Pottinger St, Lower Fort St from George St, Merriman St, Rodens Lane and Loftus St. In Ultimo, Mary Ann St and Omnibus Lane will close. 

Fridays

  • 5pm – midnight: George St north of Essex St, Hickson Rd to Pottinger St, Pottinger St, Lower Fort St, Windmill St, Merriman St, Rodens Lane and Loftus St. In Ultimo, Mary Ann St and Omnibus Lane will close. 
  • 6pm – midnight: roads in Circular Quay north of Bridge St including sections of George, Pitt, Young, Phillip and Loftus Streets, and in Ultimo, Darling Dr between Pier St and Ultimo Rd.
  • 7pm – midnight: Erskine St westbound from Clarence St to Sussex St and Kent St southbound from Margaret St to Erskine St approaching King St Wharf.
  • Each weekend from 2pm Friday to 1am Monday, George St will close between Lower Fort St and Hickson Rd for The Rocks markets.

Saturdays and long weekend Sunday (9 June)

  • 5pm - 1am: Grosvenor St/Bridge St between York St and Loftus St, Hickson Rd from Pottinger St to George St, Pottinger St, sections of Lower Fort St, Windmill St, Merriman St, Rodens Lane, and roads in Circular Quay north of Bridge St including sections of George, Pitt, Young, Phillip and Loftus Streets. Near King St Wharf, Erskine St westbound from Clarence St to Sussex St and Kent St southbound from Margaret St to Erskine St will close.
  • No access east/west across the city via Grosvenor/Bridge Streets.
  • 5.30pm - midnight: Darling Dr between Pier St and Ultimo Rd.
  • 7pm - 11pm: Wheat Rd from Harbour St at Darling Harbour.
  • Milsons Point - Saturday 8, Sunday 9 and Saturday 15 June only from 8pm - 10pm: Olympic Drive/Broughton from Alfred St Sth to Fitzroy St.

Sundays and public holiday Monday (10 June)

  • 5pm – midnight: Hickson Rd to Pottinger St, Pottinger St, Lower Fort St, Windmill St, Merriman St, Rodens Lane and Loftus St. In Ultimo, Mary Ann St and Omnibus Lane will close. Roads in Circular Quay north of Bridge St including sections of George, Pitt, Young, Phillip and Loftus Streets. Near King St Wharf, Erskine St westbound from Clarence St to Sussex St and Kent St southbound from Margaret St to Erskine St will close.
  • 5.30pm - midnight: Darling Dr between Pier St and Ultimo Rd.

Managed access to some hotels and businesses around The Rocks and Circular Quay will be maintained by traffic controllers on-site throughout Vivid Sydney when safe to do so.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 3pm to midnight each night on various key roads around Circular Quay and The Rocks, with more widespread clearways in the Sydney CBD in effect on weekends. Some clearways will be in effect on local roads earlier in the day.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

roads.mainStreet: George Street, Hickson Road, Bridge St, Grosvenor Street
roads.suburb: Sydney CBD, Circular Quay, The Rocks, Walsh Bay, Barangaroo, Darling Harbour

properties.otherAdvice:
The Enchanted Forest is returning to Shellharbour, from Friday 24 May until Sunday 16 June with the event running from 5.45pm to 10pm Sunday to Thursday and from 5.45pm to 10.30pm Friday and Saturday.

For the duration of the event, a speed reduction will be in place on Shellharbour Rd.

3000 people are expected to take place in the Queanbeyan Reconciliation March on Tuesday 28 May from 9.30am to 11.30am.

The walk will commence at Trinculo Place and move along Monaro St before finishing at Lowe St.
properties.diversions: A detour will be in place via Atkinson St, Morisset St, Lowe St and Campbell St.

properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney Film Festival at the State Theatre on Thursday 6 June from 6pm to 10pm.

Lane and footpath closures will be in place on Market St between Pitt St and George St for the event:

  • From 10am to 11pm, the southern footpath on Market St will be closed to pedestrians.
  • From 4am until 1am (Fri 7 June), lanes 1 and 4 on Market St will be closed.

Motorist should expect traffic delays along Market St during the event, allow extra travel time in the area and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads around the theatre.

properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Back to Guildford Street Festival will be taking place on Saturday 25 May from 3pm to 9pm on Guildford Rd.

To accommodate the event Guildford Rd will be closed between Bolton St and Railway Tce from 5am until midnight. Sections of Cross St, Station St and the entry to Talbot Rd from Guildford Rd will also be closed. Motorists can detour around the closures via Railway Tce, Mountford Ave, Marian St, Bolton St, Cross St, and Station St.

Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time, be aware of increased pedestrian activity and follow the directions of traffic control.

AFL: GWS Giants v Western Bulldogs at ENGIE Stadium, Sydney Olympic Park. First bounce 4.35pm, full time around 7.20pm.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park while fans travel to and from the game at ENGIE Stadium.

Allow extra travel time on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees who need to drive are urged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space - available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. View the interactive map for closure details.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men Semi Final: Central Coast Mariners v Sydney FC at Industree Group Stadium. Kick-off at 7:45pm finish around 9:35pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will close before the match from 5pm between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St for the safety of pedestrians and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

The Tenterfield Endurance Riding Club will hold their next event on Saturday 18 May from 12pm to 4pm and Sunday 19 May from 4am to 2pm. Motorists are advised to exercise caution with horses crossing the Bruxner Highway and (stop/slow) traffic conditions in place.
